alert.note: Alert for Kaufman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 4:48PM CDT until April 20 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northern portions of Kaufman Co. in North Texas * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Mesquite, Terrell, Seagoville, Forney, Kaufman, Sunnyvale, Crandall, Combine, Talty, New Terrell City Lake, Elmo, Oak Grove, Post Oak Bend City, Oak Ridge, Lawrence, Heartland, Ola, Rand and Lake Ray Hubbard.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
